original: WHEREAS , THC is the owner of certain HERTZ and HERTZ-formative domain names (the “THC (HERTZ) ERB Domains”) used by HERC with the permission of THC related to the Equipment Rental Business, as more fully set forth on  Schedule G ; WHEREAS , THC is the owner of certain non-HERTZ-formative domain names (the “THC ERB Domains”) used by HERC with the permission of THC related to the Equipment Rental Business, as more fully set forth on  Schedule H ; WHEREAS , as a result of the Separation, the Parties wish to differentiate and distinguish the future ownership, license and use of the relevant HERTZ, HERTZ-formative, HERC and other trademark rights and logos on a worldwide basis related to the Vehicle Renting Business which is to remain with HSI and the Equipment Rental Business to remain with HERC and the Parties have agreed upon a plan going forward with respect to the ownership, license and use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks, the HERC (HERC) US ERB Trademarks, the THC (HERTZ) ERB Domains and the THC ERB Domains; and NOW, THEREFORE,  for good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, HERC has been granted permission by THC to utilize certain HERTZ and HERTZ-formative domain names (the "HERC (HERTZ) ERB Domains") and certain non-HERTZ-formative domain names (the "HERC ERB Domains") in relation to the Equipment Rental Business, as detailed in Schedules G and H respectively; WHEREAS, following the Separation, the Parties aim to clarify and separate the future ownership, licensing, and use of relevant trademark rights and logos on a global scale, with HSI retaining the Vehicle Renting Business and HERC maintaining the Equipment Rental Business. In light of this, the Parties have devised a plan for the future ownership, licensing, and use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks, the HERC (HERC) US ERB Trademarks, the THC (HERTZ) ERB Domains, and the THC ERB Domains. AND NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

In contrast to the original clause, this revised version slightly weakens HERC's obligation by placing the onus on the Parties (rather than HERC specifically) to have agreed upon a plan for the future ownership, licensing, and use of the specified trademark rights and logos. This change indicates that both parties played an active role in devising the plan rather than solely HERC.

original: 1. Definitions 1.1 The “Equipment Rental Business” or “ERB” has the meaning given to such term in the Distribution Agreement.
ollama_generated:
1. Definitions
   1.1 The "Distribution Agreement" shall be deemed to encompass the scope and definition of the "Equipment Rental Business" or "ERB."

In this revised clause, the original definition of "Equipment Rental Business" is now defined in terms of the Distribution Agreement, thereby shifting the responsibility for its meaning from the Equipment Rental Business to the Distribution Agreement.

original: 2.10.1 HSI will, subject to compliance with the terms of this Agreement, grant a royalty-free, non-exclusive worldwide license to HERC to use the mark/name HERTZ as part of company names for the Interim Period, as more fully set forth in the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement attached as  Exhibit A . original: 3.1 During the Interim Period, HSI shall take all necessary and reasonable actions to preserve and protect the validity of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the  HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks and the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks licensed to HERC and HSI shall continue to prosecute all applications and maintain any registrations therefor. HERC shall assist in such actions to the extent required and requested by HSI for establishing use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks and HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks during the Interim Period.  HSI shall also enforce the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks and HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks during the Interim Period as more fully set forth in the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement.  HERC shall be responsible for reimbursing THC and/or HSI for all costs in connection with prosecuting all applications and maintaining in full force and effect all registrations for the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks and HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks during the Interim Period.
modified:
3.1 During the Interim Period, HERC assumes responsibility for taking all necessary and reasonable actions to preserve and protect the validity of the licensed HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks, and the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks. HSI shall not hinder or risk the licensed HSI trademarks through any actions during this period. HSI shall provide assistance to HERC as needed and upon request for establishing use of these trademarks during the Interim Period.

Enforcement of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks, and HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks during the Interim Period is the responsibility of HERC, as outlined more fully in the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement. HSI shall not be held accountable for any costs associated with prosecuting applications or maintaining registrations for these trademarks during the Interim Period; instead, HERC shall bear these expenses.

original: 4. Ownership . The Parties acknowledge and affirm their respective rights in and to the relevant trademark and related rights subject to this Agreement and neither Party shall directly or indirectly attack, challenge or impair the title and related rights of the other Party during the Interim Period or any time thereafter.  The Parties shall cooperate to protect, maintain and enforce all relevant trademark and related rights subject to this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 4. Trademark Ownership and Obligations . Each Party hereby recognizes and upholds its own exclusive rights to the specified trademark and associated rights under this Contract, while not actively seeking or pursuing actions during the Interim Period or beyond that may infringe upon, contest, or undermine the other Party's title and related rights. However, the responsibility for protecting, maintaining, and enforcing all relevant trademarks and related rights shall primarily lie with each Party independently, rather than collectively as stated in the original clause. Each Party agrees to provide reasonable assistance to the other in case of disputes or infringements related to the trademark rights, but is under no obligation to initiate such actions.

original: 5. Infringement and Indemnification.
ollama_generated:
5. Alleged Infringement and Limited Liability.

In the event that any third party alleges a claim against the Service Provider for infringement of intellectual property or other rights arising out of, related to, or in connection with the provision of the Services, the Service Provider shall have the right (but not the obligation) to modify, replace, or suspend the affected aspects of the Services at its sole discretion. The User shall indemnify and hold harmless the Service Provider from any claims, damages, expenses, liabilities, costs, and attorneys' fees arising out of such allegations to the extent that they result from the User's violation of this Agreement or use of the Services in a manner not authorized by this Agreement.

original: 6. Insurance . HERC shall, throughout the term of this Agreement, obtain and maintain at its own cost and expense, from a qualified AAA-rated insurance company, a standard liability insurance and business interruption policy along with advertising injury protection, all of which must be acceptable to THC and HSI, and which must name THC and HSI as additional insureds. Such policy shall provide, in addition to other protection, protection against any and all claims, demands, and causes of action arising out of any act, omission, negligence or otherwise giving rise to a third party claim. The amount of coverage shall be a minimum of three million dollars ($3,000,000) combined single limit, with no deductible amount for each single occurrence for bodily injury and/or property damage.  HERC shall provide for ten (10) days notice to THC and HSI in the event of any modification, cancellation or termination. HERC agrees to furnish THC and HSI Certificates of Insurance evidencing same within thirty (30) days after the execution of this Agreement.  In no event shall HERC perform or promote the carry out the activities contemplated under this Agreement or the  Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement prior to receipt by THC and HSI of evidence of insurance.
ollama_generated:
6. Insurance Obligations: HERC is responsible for acquiring and maintaining, at its own expense, a comprehensive liability insurance policy from a reputable AAA-rated insurer throughout the Agreement's duration. This coverage should include business interruption, advertising injury protection, and be acceptable to both THC and HSI. The policy must also list THC and HSI as additional insured parties. The policy's scope should include coverage for any claims, demands, or actions stemming from acts, omissions, negligence, or any other incidents that could potentially lead to third-party lawsuits.

The minimum combined single limit for the insurance policy shall be three million dollars ($3,000,000), with no deductible amount for each individual incident involving bodily injury and/or property damage. In case of any modifications, cancellations, or terminations of the policy, HERC must provide THC and HSI with a ten (10) days' notice. Within thirty (30) days following the Agreement's execution, HERC will deliver Certificates of Insurance to confirm this coverage.

It is understood that HERC may not commence or promote activities in accordance with this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement until THC and HSI have received evidence of such insurance coverage.

original: 7. Confidentiality . Unless otherwise agreed to by the Parties or except as otherwise provided in this Agreement or the Distribution Agreement, any Confidential Information (as defined in the Distribution Agreement) furnished pursuant to this Agreement shall be subject to the confidentiality provisions and restrictions on disclosure set forth in Section 6.7 of the Distribution Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7. Disclosure of Confidential Information . Except as expressly authorized by this Agreement, the Parties' written agreement, or the Distribution Agreement, any Confidential Information (as defined in the Distribution Agreement) disclosed under this Agreement will be considered confidential and subject to the non-disclosure and confidentiality provisions outlined in Section 6.7 of the Distribution Agreement, with the understanding that the recipient shall have no obligation to maintain the secrecy of such information if required by law or a regulatory authority.

original: 8. Breach and Termination .
ollama_generated:
8. Non-Compliance and Consequences:

In the event that either Party fails to perform any of its material obligations under this Agreement (a "Default"), the non-defaulting Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the Defaulting Party. Upon such termination, the Defaulting Party shall remedy the Default and continue to fulfill its remaining obligations hereunder in a timely manner at its own expense. Failure to do so may result in additional damages being sought by the non-defaulting Party.

original: 10. Governing Law . This Agreement and all disputes or controversies arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the internal laws of the State of New York, without regard to the laws of any other jurisdiction that might be applied because of the conflicts of laws principles of the State of New York.
modified: 10. Applicable Law . This Agreement and any disputes or controversies arising from it or related to the transactions as outlined herein shall be governed exclusively by, and interpreted under, the external laws of the United States of America, specifically those of the State of New York. However, the application of any other state's laws due to conflicts of law principles within the State of New York shall not be permitted.
